label: Description
value: Accordion-pleated stiff paper folder with front board cover with dark imitation pebbled leather printed in gold, "Compliments of the New York Watering Co., Printing, Moiré, Re-dyeing and Finishing." Contains numbered samples, stapled to pages, of metallic trimmings that are stamped, woven and printed in imitation of chiné designs.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: paper, cotton, silk, metallic thread

label: Description
value: Notebook with dark leather corners and back, with board covers covered with polychrome marbled paper, and plain pages on which are pasted 94 wide ribbon samples in polychrome and white silk, and one section of coarse cotton cloth printed with roses. Samples include chine, satin stripes, satin printed, fancy cloth, ribbed cloth, printed cotton.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D: 35.5 x 24.5 cm (14 x 9 5/8 in.) 184 pages

label: Description
value: Cape for an altar figure in pink satin embroidered in silver thread in a flower and foliage design. Scattered small detached flower design. Edging of narrow silver lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered on satin weave

label: Description
value: Apron for an altar figure in pink satin embroidered in silver thread. With 1949-83-2 forms costume for figure of Infant Jesus.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered on satin

label: Description
value: Towel of dark red cotton in a crêpe weave. Ends embroidered in simple detached flower sprays of blossoms surmounted by curving leaf form. Center of flower, drawn and embroidered in gold; outlined in gold. Simple border design and buttonhole edge.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Towel of white hand-woven cotton with ends embroidered in detached designs, simulating an island with tall trees and other forms. Pattern embroidered in red, rose, green, light blue and gold. Simple border of block design in gold and colors.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Towel of white hand-woven cotton, narrow width (9 1/16 in. from selvage to selvage). Ends embroidered in silk design of double row of stylized jars of flowers, alternating with tall trees. Colors: rose, green, and yellow and blue, flat gold.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk, metal thread Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Cotton towel with ends embroidered in silks and metal thread. Design appears to be house with groups of towers at side. Worked entirely in drawnwork, embroidered over in colors; parts outlined in flat metal and metal thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk, metal thread Technique: embroidery, drawnwork

label: Description
value: Cotton towel with ends embroidered in colored silks and flat metal. Design of flower clusters on either side of a jar or fountain. One selvage present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk, and metal thread Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Cylindrical body with shaped flat handle. Frieze of so-called “Prince Eugene” ornament (symmetrical arabesques). In gilt enframement, a polychrome medallion of a woman and child playing musical instruments.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Provenance
value: January, 1949: Purchased from M. Glueckselig & Son, New York, NY, by Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration; Prior to 1949: in collection of H. Rothberger, Vienna, Austria.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor G. Hewitt

label: Description
value: Printed fragment with a wide border of Chinoiserie motifs and in an allover pattern of pagodas, birds on a tree and vase with flowers. Printed in red on a yellow ground.

value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave; three blue warp threads in each selvage

label: Description
value: Button depicting scene with four figures in a landscape with palm trees. At left, a light-skinned man at entrance of a hut, as black-skinned man and woman, dressed in Western style working clothes, converse with another woman who wears only a skirt, carrying a child on her back and a package on her head.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache paint on ivory verre fixé (affixed to) glass, ivory (backing), gilt metal

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 1 x 3.7 cm (3/8 x 1 7/16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: c. 1802: Toussaint L'Ouverture, upon return to France from Haiti and Santo Domingo gives jacket with these buttons to servant boy [1];  acquired by boy's heirs in the Sedan;  Professor Lalongt, College of Sedan acquires from heirs [2];  ? - 1939: sold to Etienne Accary, Paris; 1939: his sale, Salle Drouot auction house, Paris [3];  1939: purchased by Pauline Riggs Noyes [Mrs. Robert B. Noyes], Pomfret, Connecticut, and New York; 1942-1949: on long-term loan to the Cooper Union Museum 1949: gift to the Museum from the estate of Mrs. Noyes   [1] Given to servant boy for his loyal service to Toussaint L'Ouverture  in the prison in Besancon, France from his capture in Haiti to his death in Besancon in 1813 [2] Letter from Jean Milare tells story of servant boy and Toussaint [3] Buttons arrive, possibly as a loan, at Cooper Union Museum around 1942

label: Credit line
value: Gift of R. Keith Kane from the Estate of Mrs. Robert B. Noyes

label: Description
value: Button depicting scene of three women in the foreground and a seated man in the background in a partial landscape. The women are all wearing white dresses, turbans and scarves around their necks. The central figure wears a dark turban and has lighter skin than the other two.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache paint on tin verre fixé, ivory (backing), glass, gilt metal
